thread.title: Basketball Player Suffers Gruesome Injury when Eyeball is Popped Out During Game
thread.title_full: Basketball Player Suffers Gruesome Injury when Eyeball is Popped Out During Game

author: Warner Todd Huston
title: Basketball Player Suffers Gruesome Injury when Eyeball is Popped Out During Game
text: Akil Mitchell, a former University of Virginia basketball player who now plays for the New Zealand Breakers, suffered one of the most gruesome injuries you’ll ever see during a recent game. His eye popped out of its socket after a defender accidentally hit him in the face while they were both going for a rebound. Mitchell remained on the ground writhing in pain for about 15 minutes before he was helped off the court. Fortunately, he didn’t sustain any major damage to his eye, and it sounds like he will be fine after a brief recovery period. But the injury is still incredibly hard to watch.
